move-help-entry.name: mvMultivariatePhyloProcessTranslation
move-help-entry.title: Metropolis-Hastings translation move on the node values of a multivariate process.

description.p: This move function performs a global translation on one random entry of a multivariate process (multivariate quantitative trait) along a phylogeny.

constructor-help-entry.usage: mvMultivariatePhyloProcessTranslation( MultivariateRealNodeValTree process, RealPos lambda = 1, Bool tune = TRUE, RealPos weight = 1 )

argument.label: lambda
argument.description: The tuning parameter or size of the proposal.

argument.label: tune
argument.description: This flag specifies if the proposal tuning parameter (lambda) is retuned during the burnin period.

argument.label: weight
argument.description: The expected number of times this move will be applied per iteration.

details.p: This move proposes a random translation to a multivariate real process (which can be seen as representing the joint evolution of multiple and correlated quantitative traits) along a phylogeny. An entry of the multivariate process (i.e. one of the traits whose joint evolution is model by the multivariate process) is chosen at random, and a translation by a random amount is applied uniformly to this trait across all of the nodes of the phylogenetic tree for which the trait is not clamped.

constructor-help-entry.example:
# load trait data contData <- readContinuousCharacterData("data/plac40lhtlog.nex") nTraits <- contData.nchar()[1]
# load tree tree <- readTrees("data/chronoplac40.tree")[1]
# covariance matrix with free scaling factor kappa kappa ~ dnLogUniform(min=0.001,max=1000) Sigma ~ dnInvWishart(dim=nTraits, kappa=kappa, df=nTraits+1)
# bivariate Brownian process along the tree X ~ dnBrownianMultiVariate(tree,sigma=Sigma)
# clamp process at the tips of the tree to observed trait values for (i in 1:nTraits) { X.clampAt(contData,i,i) }
...
# set up index for array of moves index <- 1
# conjugate Gibbs move on covariance matrix moves[index++] = mvConjugateInverseWishartBrownian(sigma=Sigma, process=X, kappa=kappa, df=df, weight=1)
# moves on the Brownian process moves[index++] = mvMultivariatePhyloProcessSliding(process=X,lambda=1,tune=true,weight=100) moves[index++] = mvMultivariatePhyloProcessTranslation(process=X,lambda=0.1,tune=true,weight=1)

reference.citation: Lartillot N and Poujol R. 2011. A phylogenetic model for investigating correlated evolution of substitution rates and continuous phenotypic characters. Mol Biol Evol 28:729-744.

constructor-help-entry.author: Nicolas Lartillot
